content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks very nice to me :)

Nice puzzle! The logic is clear and the test cases cover the mechanics nicely (especially the varying heights).

Just one minor suggestion for robustness: consider adding a test case where an obstacle is at the very top edge, causing the shadow to go 'out of bounds'. Most codes handle this naturally, but it's a good edge case to test. 
E.g: 
1 4
5
9
P
P
P

(But you have my vote already ;))

Goal
* Please format "1" and "9" as {{constants}}.

* Please change "Height" to "Obstacle height".

* Please add "(shadow coefficient)" after "[[K]]".

* Please remove "(even partially)" because cells are either shaded or not; there's no such thing as "partial" coverage in the puzzle.

* Please change "units" to "Watts".

Input
* Please delete "(Shadow Length = Height * K)".

* Please format all variables.

* Please format ".", "P", "1" and "9" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* Please format "Line 1", "Line 2" and "Next [[H]] lines" in <<bold>>.

Output
* Please format "Line 1" in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* Please format all variables.

* Please either change 50 to 10, or create new cases to fully utilise the range of values between 10 and 50 for [[W]] and [[H]].

Stub generator
* Please change 50 to W.

Cases
* Please ensure a balanced mix of grid dimensions across tests (h > w, h = w, h < w).

* Please ensure a balanced mix of grid dimensions across validators (h > w, h = w, h < w).

* Please add new cases where one or more of the following conditions hold (and each condition must exist in at least one pair of new cases):

  • Panels are found at the bottom (south).

  • Obstacles of all possible heights (1 to 9).

  • Multiple obstacles in the same column, including both identical and varying heights.

  • Shadows extend partially or completely outside the grid.

Thanks.

Hi!

Thank you so much for the detailed feedback! It was incredibly helpful, especially regarding the formatting syntax and edge cases I missed.

I have updated the contribution to incorporate all your suggestions, including the specific formatting tags, clearer wording, and a more balanced set of test cases covering all constraints.

Could you please take a look at the revised version when you have a moment?

Thanks again for your guidance!

Thank you for your quick response and updates. At this point, the remaining concerns are mainly related to the constraints and the test cases.

Constraints (same point as before)
* Please either change 50 to 10, or create new cases to fully utilise the range of values between 10 and 50 for [[W]] and [[H]].

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs and outputs.

* You are not limited to four pairs. In fact, adding more pairs is encouraged to ensure better coverage and more robust testing.

* Some of the original cases were well-designed and already formed good matching pairs. It would be helpful to restore those where possible. For example, the following works better as Validator 1:

Input
3 4
1
.P.
.P.
.1.
...
Output
100

* Please don't discard the new cases you created. Instead, reuse them when redesigning proper test–validator pairs. For instance, Test 3 is currently not aligned with Validator 3. A new test that includes obstacle heights from 1 to 9 would pair more appropriately with Validator 3.

* The same principle (each test and its validator should be closely matched) should be applied consistently across all pairs, along with the conditions mentioned in my previous comments.

Thanks again.

Hi!

Thank you for the clear guidance.

I have updated the contribution to address your points regarding the constraints and test case pairing. The test suite now ensures better coverage and proper alignment between all tests and validators.

Thanks again for your help!

Thank you for the guidance. I have implemented all the requested updates to the difficulty setting and the test suite, including the adjustments to the existing pairs and the addition of the new large-scale scenario. Could you please take a final look to ensure everything is now correct?
Every test is now similar to its validator and the coverage is better now. Thank you.
